comments:
3.2

I came back from a break to find my development workspace had died with an OutOfMemoryError.  Actually, it was still running, consuming 50% CPU, but the UI was unresponsive.

The last few entries in the log were as follows.
The ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException occurred just before the first OOME (less than two seconds before).  Not sure if that ended up triggering the OOME, or if they're just coincidental.

Created an attachment (id=49211)
Full thread dump

I took a full thread dump when I came back, about 40 minutes after the errors above.  It showed the Java builder's call to createMarker waiting on the workspace lock, and apparently no other threads holding it.

It looks like this session was in a bad state due to OutOfMemoryError. Once the VM is out of memory, secondary failures are likely to happen.  Since one of the OOME occurred while releasing a lock, it doesn't surprise me that the process ended up hung on that lock.  Not much we can do about this, unless there's a reproducible case that produces the OOME.
